info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 09 at 11:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON COUNTY... At 1145 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Seabrook Island, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include: Johns Island, Seabrook Island, Kiawah Island and Wadmalaw Island. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
